text:
<@U08JPUZRT40> <@U08G2A216TW> <@U08GJSBAX3K> <@U08FZDRRY8Z>
*RxC monthly community call is taking place tonight from 1 to 2 am, JST.*
*Will anyone be going to present the progress and asks/wishes of the DD2030 project?*

I believe the project is the most vibrant one, and it can be positioned as the best powerhouse of the world in terms of its velocity and human power going into the subprojects. It is usually around one minute window where call participants can comfortably present any thoughts and doubts, or their projects or events.
The brief presentation of DD2030 may pave our way to attract more developers or designers who are enthusiastic and experienced. The project information can also indicate the tractions that the team has gained after the presentation of DD2030 at Plurality Institute gathering (I am referring to this, <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z_xLiYiBIf0>).

Please let me know if anyone is going to present or wants me to present, and what you like to share with RxC. I am going to share the vibes anyway (rather as a reporter to the RxC because of the least contribution and involvement for the past period).

It may help the RxC organizer if *a speaker fills out a TypeForm survey to secure the spot and have the topic listed in their minutes of meeting (MOM).* I am going to submit one around 12:30am - midnight, if nobody is doing so and everyone (or solely<@U08FZDRRY8Z> ) feels ok.

@takagishunsuke1129 @nishio.hirokazu @shutaro.aoyama @annyotaka
*RxC monthly community call is taking place tonight from 1 to 2 am, JST.*
*Will anyone be going to present the progress and asks/wishes of the DD2030 project?*

I believe the project is the most vibrant one, and it can be positioned as the best powerhouse of the world in terms of its velocity and human power going into the subprojects. It is usually around one minute window where call participants can comfortably present any thoughts and doubts, or their projects or events.
The brief presentation of DD2030 may pave our way to attract more developers or designers who are enthusiastic and experienced. The project information can also indicate the tractions that the team has gained after the presentation of DD2030 at Plurality Institute gathering (I am referring to this, <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z_xLiYiBIf0>).

Please let me know if anyone is going to present or wants me to present, and what you like to share with RxC. I am going to share the vibes anyway (rather as a reporter to the RxC because of the least contribution and involvement for the past period).

It may help the RxC organizer if *a speaker fills out a TypeForm survey to secure the spot and have the topic listed in their minutes of meeting (MOM).* I am going to submit one around 12:30am - midnight, if nobody is doing so and everyone (or solely@annyotaka ) feels ok.

text:
Thank you~~~!!

In addition to the project setup phase and background, it would be not only advantageous but also encouraging if the team can share the highly accelerated growth (and, of course, also add something that the team is proud of and it wants to promote in such a community call.)

text:
This will be submitted through TypeForm.

The project, Digital Democracy 2030, is the most vibrant project. It might be regarded as the best powerhouse of the world in terms of its velocity and human power increasingly going into the subprojects. The call of developers through Twitter on March 13 has attracted more than 400 people until now.
It has two major subproject. The first is an evolved version of TTTC, "kochou-ai" (<https://x.com/nishio/status/1901289515966456305>), and the other is a large-scale deliberation system, "idobata" (<https://x.com/takahiroanno/status/1901193771351494930>). Another project aims to seek the politican's financial transparency and accountability.
The information invitation can be found in here (<https://x.com/takahiroanno/status/1900073162370658464>, and quoted/reply tweets).
The progress is updated to GitHub Gist, <https://gist.github.com/nishio/dd27b61d08fcd29c845a9381579870d7> (March 22 to 29 example.), notably the issued created totaled 30 and the closed issues, 22.

The invitation is still open and the progress is updated regularly.

It might be regarded as the best powerhouse of the world in terms of its velocity and human power increasingly going into the subprojects. The call of developers through Twitter on March 13 has attracted more than 400 people until now.

The first is an evolved version of TTTC, "kochou-ai" (<https://x.com/nishio/status/1901289515966456305>), and the other is a large-scale deliberation system, "idobata" (<https://x.com/takahiroanno/status/1901193771351494930>).
